command: python3 -c "import socket; mac='aa:bb:cc:dd:ee:ff'.replace(':',''); pkt=bytes.fromhex('ff'*6 + mac*16); s=socket.socket(socket.AF_INET,socket.SOCK_DGRAM); s.setsockopt(socket.SOL_SOCKET,socket.SO_BROADCAST,1); s.sendto(pkt,('255.255.255.255',9))" && sleep 10 && ssh user@192.168.1.50
explanation: Generates a Wake-on-LAN magic packet (6 bytes of 0xFF followed by 16 repetitions of the target MAC) to power on a sleeping host, waits briefly, then initiates SSH. Detection: monitor for WOL frames on broadcast (UDP/9) and correlate with device power events followed by immediate SSH logins; restrict WOL broadcast domains.
rationale_steps: Construct a valid WOL magic packet and broadcast it to wake the target device.
Allow time for boot and network readiness.
Attempt SSH to the newly awakened host.
Detect by watching for broadcast magic packets and subsequent SSH activity from the same source.
